Detailed Description

Class containing members and methods to allow a PC to communicate with Comau C4Gopen.

bool C4gOpen::startWithRtTask (  )  [private]

Start a C4gOpen instance, initializing a brand new RTAI task.

This method calls, in order, initRealTimeSocket() to create an RTnet socket, initRealTimeTask() to create an RTAI hard real-time task, and waitInitPacket() to wait for the arrival of the initialization packet from C4G.

Returns:
True if RTnet socket and RTAI task are successfully initialized and if the initialization packet is correctly received, false if an error occurred and lastError is appropriately set:
  • RT_TASK_INIT_ERROR if the task has not been successfully initialized;
  • RT_SOCKET_INIT_ERROR if the socket has not been successfully created or bound.

Definition at line 252 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References initRealTimeSocket(), initRealTimeTask(), lastError, RT_SOCKET_INIT_ERROR, RT_TASK_INIT_ERROR, and waitInitPacket().

Referenced by start().

bool C4gOpen::startWithoutRtTask (  )  [private]

Start a C4gOpen instance, without initializing an RTAI task.

This method calls, in order, initRealTimeSocket() to create an RTnet socket, and waitInitPacket() to wait for the arrival of the initialization packet from C4G.

Returns:
True if RTnet socket and the initialization packet is correctly received, false if an error occurred and lastError is set to RT_SOCKET_INIT_ERROR if the socket has not been successfully created or bound.

bool C4gOpen::initRealTimeSocket (  )  [private]

Initialize an RTnet socket.

This method creates an RTnet UDP socket and binds it to port portNumber, on which the server running on PC listens to C4G client requests.

Returns:
True if the socket is successfully created and bound, false otherwise and lastError is appropriately set:
  • RT_SOCKET_OPEN_ERROR if the socket has not been successfully created;
  • RT_SOCKET_BINDING_ERROR if the socket has not been successfully bound.

Definition at line 313 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References lastError, portNumber, realTimeSocket, realTimeSocketStruct, RT_SOCKET_BINDING_ERROR, and RT_SOCKET_OPEN_ERROR.

Referenced by startWithoutRtTask(), and startWithRtTask().

bool C4gOpen::initRealTimeTask (  )  [private]

Initialize an RTAI task.

This method creates an RTAI hard real-time task, named "C4G", oneshot and with FIFO scheduling, and starts a hard timer if no other is already running.

Returns:
True if the task is successfully created, false otherwise and lastError is set to RT_TASK_INIT_ERROR.

Definition at line 345 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References lastError, realTimeTask, RT_TASK_INIT_ERROR, and STACK_SIZE_KB.

Referenced by startWithRtTask().

bool C4gOpen::waitInitPacket (  )  [private]

Wait for the arrival of the initialization packet.

This method handles the reception of the initialization packet from C4G.

If C4G has been restarted, this method receives 9 synchronization packets, then it receives the inizialization packet (with sequence number equal to 10) and calls readInitPacket(), eventually it receives other 2 synchronization packets before starting the normal communication.

If C4G client has been restarted (special mode 506), this method receives immediately the inizialization packet (with sequence number equal to 10) and calls readInitPacket().

When a timeout set to WAIT_INIT_PCK_TIMEOUT expires, this method returns false.

Returns:
True if the initialization packet is successfully received, false otherwise and lastError is appropriately set:
  • INIT_PACKET_UNEXPECTED_SEQ_NUM if the initialization packet has an unexpected sequence number;
  • INIT_PACKET_RECEIVE_ERROR if the initialization packet has not been successfully received.

Definition at line 387 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References commPacketTx, COMMUNICATION_TIMEOUT, INIT_PACKET_RECEIVE_ERROR, INIT_PACKET_UNEXPECTED_SEQ_NUM, lastError, MAX_SIZE_OF_PACKETS, readInitPacket(), receivePacket(), sendPacket(), setCommunicationTimeout(), startUpPacket, and WAIT_INIT_PCK_TIMEOUT.

Referenced by startWithoutRtTask(), and startWithRtTask().

bool C4gOpen::readInitPacket (  )  [private]

Read a just received initialization packet.

This method reads a just received initialization packet, extracting informations to be passed to mapIndices() in order to map open axes to logical ones.

Returns:
True if the initialization packet is successfully read and replied, false otherwise.

void C4gOpen::mapIndices ( int  arm,
long  armOpenAxesMap[MAX_NUM_AXES_PER_ARM] 
) [private]

Map open axes to logical ones.

This method reads the armOpenAxesMap field of the initialization packet passed as argument and initializes logicalToOpenMap array in order to create a mapping between open axes and logical ones that is used when the fields of an outgoing communication packet are written (by calling getOpenIndex()).

Parameters:
arm Number of the arm.
armOpenAxesMap Open/Logical axes map of the specified arm.

) [private]

bool C4gOpen::checkArm ( int  arm  )  [private]

Check validity of an arm.

This method ckecks if the specified arm is a valid one, i.e. if the arm is in the range [1-4] and is open.

Parameters:
arm Number of the arm.
Returns:
True if the specified arm is valid, false otherwise and lastError is appropriately set:
  • INVALID_ARM_NUMBER if the arm is not in the range [1-4];
  • ARM_NOT_IN_OPEN_MODE if the arm is not open.

int  axis 
) [private]

Check validity of an axis.

This method ckecks if the specified arm is a valid one, by calling checkArm(), and if the specified axis is a valid one, i.e. if the axis is in the range [1-10] and is open.

bool C4gOpen::checkFollowingError ( int  arm,
int  axis,
float  targetPosition 
) [private]

Check following error threshold overcoming.

This method checks if the following error threshold of the specified axis has been overcome, i.e. the absolute value of the difference between target position and actual position of the specified axis overcomes the threshold.

If the following error threshold has been overcome, send() will set the AxisDataTx::mode field to C4G_OPEN_FOLLOWING_ERROR.

Parameters:
arm Number of the arm.
axis Number of the axis.
targetPosition Target position set for the specified axis.
Returns:
True if the following error threshold has not been overcome, false otherwise and lastError is set to FOLLOWING_ERROR_OVERCOME.

Definition at line 1677 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References FOLLOWING_ERROR_OVERCOME, followingErrorOvercome, getActualPosition(), getFollowingErrorThreshold(), getOpenIndex(), and lastError.

Referenced by setTargetPosition().

bool C4gOpen::checkOperations (  )  [private]

Check the validity of operations.

This method is called before sending a communication packet to C4G in order to check if all the operations expected by the actual open mode have been performed.

For example, if the actual mode is C4G_OPEN_MODE_5, a setTargetPosition and a setTargetVelocity are expected, otherwise lastError is appropriately set to SET_TARGET_POSITION_MISSING or SET_TARGET_VELOCITY_MISSING. If an unexpected operation has been performed, lastError is set to OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED.

Returns:
True if all the expected operations have been performed, false otherwise and lastError is appropriately set.

Definition at line 1705 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References C4G_OPEN_MODE_0, C4G_OPEN_MODE_0_DEBUG, C4G_OPEN_MODE_1, C4G_OPEN_MODE_1_STANDBY, C4G_OPEN_MODE_2, C4G_OPEN_MODE_2_STANDBY, C4G_OPEN_MODE_4, C4G_OPEN_MODE_4_STANDBY, C4G_OPEN_MODE_5, C4G_OPEN_MODE_5_STANDBY, C4G_OPEN_MODE_7, C4G_OPEN_MODE_7_STANDBY, C4G_OPEN_MODE_8, C4G_OPEN_MODE_9, lastError, numberOfOpenAxes, OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED, SET_DELTA_CURRENT_MISSING, SET_FFW_CURRENT_MISSING, SET_FFW_VELOCITY_MISSING, SET_TARGET_POSITION_MISSING, SET_TARGET_VELOCITY_MISSING, setDeltaCurrentDone, setFeedForwardCurrentDone, setFeedForwardVelocityDone, setMeasureDone, setTargetPositionDone, and setTargetVelocityDone.

bool C4gOpen::start ( bool  taskToInit = true  ) 

Initialize a C4gOpen instance.

This method is a public interface to startWithoutRtTask() and startWithRtTask(), depending on if you have just created an RTAI task before using a C4gOpen object or not.

Parameters:
taskToInit Flag indicating if a brand new RTAI task has to be created (default is true).
Returns:
True if all the initialization procedure goes well, false otherwise.

Definition at line 233 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References startWithoutRtTask(), and startWithRtTask().

bool C4gOpen::receive (  ) 

Receive a communication packet from C4G.

This method receives a communication packet coming from C4G after having set fields of the incoming communication packet to their default value by calling resetCommPacketRx().

Returns:
True if the number of received bytes equals the size of an Rx communication packet (with numberOfOpenAxes fields), false otherwise and lastError is set to RT_SOCKET_RECEIVE_ERROR.

Definition at line 522 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References commPacketRx, errorOccurred(), lastError, numberOfOpenAxes, receivePacket(), resetCommPacketRx(), and RT_SOCKET_RECEIVE_ERROR.

bool C4gOpen::send (  ) 

Send a communication packet to C4G.

This method sends a communication packet to C4G, then set fields of the outgoing communication packet to their default value by calling resetCommPacketTx(). If any error has occurred, this method schedules a DRIVE OFF request, by setting the AxisDataTx::mode field to C4G_OPEN_DRIVE_OFF. If a following error threshold has been overcome (see checkFollowingError()), the AxisDataTx::mode field is set to C4G_OPEN_FOLLOWING_ERROR.

Returns:
True if the packet has been successfully sent, that is number of sent bytes equals the size of a Tx communication packet (with numberOfOpenAxes fields), false otherwise and lastError is set to RT_SOCKET_SEND_ERROR.

Definition at line 551 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

void C4gOpen::stop ( bool  taskToClose = true  ) 

Finalize a C4gOpen instance.

This method calls closeRealTimeTask() if a brand new RTAI task has been previously created, and closeRealTimeSocket() to close a previously opened RTnet socket.

Parameters:
taskToClose Flag indicating if a brand new created RTAI task has to be deleted (default is true).

References closeRealTimeSocket(), and closeRealTimeTask().

void C4gOpen::resetError (  ) 

Reset the last occurred error.

This method clears the last occurred error, allowing to keep the communication going on when, e.g., "Drive Off" command is sent to C4G or a "following error overcome" is detected by the PC.

bool C4gOpen::setMode ( int  arm,
long  mode 
)

Set the open mode of an arm.

This method sets the open mode of an arm, if and only if:

  • an exitFromOpen() has called in the previous step;
  • or the actual mode is 0;
  • or the specified mode is equal to the actual one.

Parameters:
arm Number of the arm.
mode Open mode to set.
Returns:
True if the mode is successfully set, false otherwise and lastError is appropriately set:
  • INVALID_OPEN_MODE if the specified mode is not a valid open mode (i.e. it is not included in validOpenModes);
  • SET_MODE_NOT_ALLOWED if the operation is not permitted (i.e. the above conditions are not satisfied).

Definition at line 1196 of file C4gOpen.cpp.

References canChangeMode, checkArm(), checkMode(), errorOccurred(), getMode(), getOpenIndex(), INVALID_OPEN_MODE, lastError, MAX_NUM_AXES_PER_ARM, SET_MODE_NOT_ALLOWED, and setModeDone.

bool C4gOpen::setTargetPosition ( int  arm,
int  axis,
float  targetPosition 
)

Set the target position of an axis in gear rotations.

This method sets the target position of the specified axis, checking if the following error threshold has been overcome.

Parameters:
arm Number of the arm.
axis Number of the axis.
targetPosition Target position of the specified axis in gear rotations.
Returns:
True if the target position has been successfully set, false if:
  • the specified arm and/or axis are not valid;
  • the following error threshold is overcome.

)

)
